meanings.definition: Looked with eyes partly closed to see more clearly.
meanings.sent1: She squinted at the tiny print to read the words better.
meanings.sent2: He squinted in the sunlight to see the road ahead.
meanings.sent3: The detective squinted at the clue, trying to decipher its meaning.
meanings.sent4: The old man squinted at the horizon, searching for a ship in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The scientist squinted through the microscope to observe the tiny organisms.

meanings.definition: Looked with eyes partly closed due to bright light or glare.
meanings.sent1: She squinted as the camera flash went off, temporarily blinding her.
meanings.sent2: He squinted at the reflection of the sun on the water.
meanings.sent3: The child squinted at the shiny object, curious about its sparkle.
meanings.sent4: The driver squinted through the windshield, trying to see through the rain.
meanings.sent5: The hiker squinted up at the mountain peak, shielding his eyes from the sun.
